thread.title: Agnieszka Radwanska wins Tianjin Open to book WTA Finals spot
thread.title_full: Agnieszka Radwanska wins Tianjin Open to book WTA Finals spot

title: Agnieszka Radwanska wins Tianjin Open to book WTA Finals spot
text:
Agnieszka Radwanska wins Tianjin Open to book WTA Finals spot 18 Oct 2015 13:02:03 
comments 
Poland's Agnieszka Radwanska booked her place at the WTA Finals event in Singapore with victory in the Tianjin Open. 
The second seed, a winner in Tokyo last month, raced past Montenegro's Danka Kovinic 6-1 6-2 in just 58 minutes with five breaks of serve. 
However, having secured her fifth successive appearance at the season-ending finale, Radwanska immediately pulled out of her next tournament in Russia to rest a shoulder injury. 
"I was really solid from the beginning. I think I was just using the conditions a little bit better today, and maybe that's why the score was like that," she said of her victory. 
"Coming to Asia I didn't really think I had any chance to go to Singapore and it's actually been a very good couple of weeks for me. 
"Winning Tokyo gave me some chances to go there and then every match started to matter after that, and I knew if I won here I would make it there. 
"But the pressure didn't feel too big. I could really play my best tennis in Tianjin this week." Related Sport News
